str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From ergates; occupation; by implication, profit, pains.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
And, even, also, namely.
Silas, a pet-form of the name Silvanus; a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul. Contraction for Silouanos; Silas, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To drag, draw, pull, persuade, unsheathe. Or helko hel'-ko; probably akin to haireomai; to drag.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Present participle of archo; a first.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From ageiro; properly, the town-square; by implication, a market or thoroughfare.
